name: src/Alarm.js
constructor
description: Construct an Alarm given a setTimeout handle.

name: record
description: Record a new setTimeout handle (and clear previous one if any).

name: src/TOLERANCE.js
src/clearAlarm.js
clearAlarm
description:
Prevents an alarm from triggering. Obviously, this does not work if the
alarm has triggered before calling `clearAlarm`. However, it is guaranteed
that if `clearAlarm` is called before `alarm` has triggered, `alarm` will
never trigger.

Does nothing on invalid arguments (it will not throw).

name: src/index.js
src/setAlarm.js
setAlarm
description:
Set an alarm to trigger at a given date/time specified by a Date object.
When triggered, the alarm will call the callback function with passed
arguments, if any.

We guarantee that the alarm will not trigger before the given date/time.
We try to trigger the alarm as soom as the given date/time has passed.

Note that we workaround two issues raised by a naive setTimeout
implementation:
  1. the delay parameter is a 32-bit signed integer
  2. taking the first point into account, the resolution time of setAlarm
  could be imprecise with large delays (because of setInterval/setTimeout
  drift).

params.name: callback
params.description: The Function to call when the alarm triggers.

params.name: date
params.description: The date/time at which to trigger the alarm.

params.name: rest
params.description: The arguments to call the callback with.

name: ./README.md
package.json
./doc/manual/installation.md
content:
# Installation

Can be managed using
[yarn](https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs),
[npm](https://docs.npmjs.com),
or [jspm](https://jspm.org/docs).


### yarn
```terminal
yarn add set-alarm
```

### npm
```terminal
npm install set-alarm --save
```

### jspm
```terminal
jspm install npm:set-alarm
```

name: ./doc/manual/usage.md
